message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.CL. 

The paper discusses continual learning algorithms, which are commonly studied in the machine learning community. The focus on evaluating these algorithms and proposing new metrics aligns with the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The use of the iCIFAR-100 benchmark suggests a focus on computer vision, which is reflected in the cs.CV (Computer Vision) sub-category. The consideration of memory overhead and computational efficiency suggests a potential focus on neural networks, which is reflected in the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category. Finally, the use of language such as "practical implications" suggests a potential focus on natural language processing, which is reflected in the cs.CL (Computation and Language) sub-category.
